spring.description: Like cherry blossoms tumbling in a breeze — light, fleeting, and full of laughter.
Like the first green shoot breaking through frost — quiet, determined, and full of promise.
Like a sparrow hopping through rain-kissed grass — head tilted, eyes wide, wondering what blooms next.
Like warm rain on bare skin — gentle, awakening, and softly vulnerable.

summer.description: Like bare feet on sun-warmed stone — glowing, alive, and unburdened by tomorrow.
Like a wildfire in dry grass — intense, consuming, and impossible to ignore.
Like lying in a field at noon, watching clouds drift — no past, no future, just now.
Like cicadas at dusk — buzzing with energy that has nowhere to go.

autumn.description: Like walking through fallen leaves — each step a memory, each rustle a question.
Like the last apple on a bare branch — sweet, but knowing winter is coming.
Like a tree shedding its gold — tired, but graceful in release.
Like the scent of woodsmoke on a cool evening — familiar, distant, and aching with warmth.

winter.description: Still, like dust in sunlight — motionless, but not dead — waiting for the wind.
Like snow falling at midnight — silent, complete, and utterly at peace.
Like a single candle in a frosted window — glowing, but unseen by the world outside.
Like an evergreen under heavy snow — bent, but not broken; quiet, but still green.
